column33: Compulsory

column1: A unique identifier for the model. Use only uncased
column2: The latent outcome (e.g., construct, behaviour) that is assessed, predicted, or classified.
column3: Describe the overall study type, either as development or usage
column4: Describe the study type in more detail, such as original development, replication, independent replication, extension/update of a model, or use in a new context.
column5:
Citation for the model and/or name of the person, group or organisation developing the model or using it.
See "Full references" for the full reference
column6: Contact details about who to contact with questions about the model or the generalisation performance
column7:
Development: The specific outcome the model was trained to or the labelling criteria used to classify the data.
Usage: the outcome the predictions were associated with
column8:
Development: The language used in the model.
Usage: the language on which the model was applied to
column9: The type of language used (e.g., social media, probed, free-text).
column10: The level of analysis (message, person, group).
column11: Number of training observations (not in usage)
column13: Description of where the training data source comes from
column14: Description of the training data source (not in usage)
column16: Type of labels used in training (e.g., self-report, annotation, interview scores, behaviour, best-estimate assessments, etc...)
column17: Does the model include a language domain distribution of the training set for assessing language domain similarity with new data?
column18: Link to data if it can be openly shared
column19: Link to code if it can be openly shared
column20: Type of model used for prediction (such as ridge regression, L2 logistic regression)
column21: The features used in the model (e.g., word embeddings, topics, demographics)
column22: Metric used to validate the model
column24: Accuracy on a held-out, out-of-population test sample
column25: Accuracy on a second held-out, out-of-population test sample
column26: A Sequential Evaluation with Model Pre-registration
column27: Describe any additional metrics from the n-fold cross-validation (if any).
column28: Describe any additional metrics from the held-out (if any).
column29: Describe any additional metrics from the held-out (if any).
column30: Describe any additional metrics from the SEMP procedure (if any).
column31: Describe and report if there were any additional evaluation metrics.
column32: If the research received ethical approval, add the application ID.
column33: Describe ethical considerations or concerns that went into the model development and testing.
column34: Approximate date the model was created
column36: Indicates whether the model is original or updated since publication (e.g., using a newer LLM); details about this can be described under Miscellaneous.
column37: Describe any other relevant information or recommendations.
column39: A unique identifier for the model, used to reference it within functions. The name should be in lowercase, and words separated by underscores. It is recommended to follow the naming convention: construct_model_reference. Additional descriptors can be appended to provide further clarification or to differentiate between versions, such as appending outcome, domain, or reference.
column40: Where the model can be accessed (e.g., OSF.io, github.com, huggingface.com)
column41: Specify how the function should handle the model argument. Setting it to “fine-tuned“ or “text-trained“ will apply their respective default behaviors, while setting it to “implicit motives“ will trigger specific steps tailored to these models.

column15: Participants_evaluation_or_generalisation
column33: Ethical_statement
column38: Command_info

column14:
Development set: Unscreened and screened respondents. Screened participants reported being diagnosed with an ongoing mental health diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD; 258) or Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD; 259), and 491 were unscreened. 
571 female, 388 male, 2 preferred not to say, 2 did not respond. The mean age is 33.3 (SD: 11.2; range: 18 – 77) years. 
Participants reported being from the U.S. (n = 284) and the U.K. (n = 679).
column15: Prospective test set: 145 unscreened participants; 101 females, 43 males, and 1 other. Mean age: 41.6 (SD: 12.6, range: 19 – 81) years; Nationality: 126 from the U.K., 5 from the U.S., and 14 from other countries. All reported English as their first language.
column33: The Swedish National Ethics Review Board deemed this research study exempt from requiring ethical approval according to Swedish Law (see §§ 3-4 of the Act [2003:460] on ethical review of research involving humans in Sweden).
column39: construct_languagetype_outcome_model_reference; where the number in the model specifies the layer.
